feed.title: NewsTracker: nemtsov
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Nemtsov's daughter: TV propaganda factor behind his killing
entry.summary: MOSCOW (AP) - The daughter of Russian opposition politician Boris Nemtsov has blamed state propaganda for fomenting hatred and intolerance that contributed to his killing in February.

entry.title: Nemtsov report: 220 Russian soldiers died in Ukraine battles
entry.summary: It was presented to the public by other opposition figures from the political party that Nemtsov co-chaired.

entry.title: Russian troops 'died in Ukraine'
entry.summary: Around 70 more Russian soldiers died in January and February in fighting around the city of Debaltseve, the report said, adding that family members were unable to receive compensation and appealed to Mr Nemtsov for help.

entry.title: Russian soldiers 'died in Ukraine'
entry.summary: According to Mr Nemtsov's sources, at least 150 Russian soldiers died in August.

entry.title: Nemtsov report: At least 220 Russian soldiers died in 2 battles in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary:
MOSCOW - A report containing material compiled by slain Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov says at least 220 Russian soldiers died in two battles in eastern Ukraine within the past year.

The 64-page report was compiled from witness reports in media accounts and information gathered by Nemtsov, including from relatives and other representatives of the dead soldiers.

entry.title: Nemtsov report: 220 Russian soldiers died in Ukraine battles
Chechen leader ready to give evidence in Nemtsov murder case
Chechen leader ready to give evidence in Nemtsov murder case, declares loyalty to Putin
entry.summary:
The main suspect in the Feb. 27 killing is an officer in Ramzan Kadyrov's security force, and Nemtsov's children have asked for Kadyrov to be questioned.

He also said his officer Zaur Dadaev should be sent to prison if found guilty of shooting Nemtsov.

entry.title: Two Russian opposition parties unite after Nemtsov killing
Chechen commander in Ukraine drawn into Russian intrigue
entry.summary:
Osmayev said he has few doubts that the perpetrators of Nemtsov's killing have ties to Kadyrov, but that the security services now need a convenient scapegoat whose guilt would be easily acceptable to the Russian general public.

"The fact the FSB is . trying to somehow implicate me in Nemtsov's murder is utterly ridiculous," Osmayev said, "but not hard to believe now that I am involved in the situation here in Ukraine."

entry.title: Chechen commander in Ukraine drawn into Russian intrigue over Nemtsov murder investigation
entry.summary:
Adam Osmayev hailed Nemtsov as a "true hero" both for condemning Russia's war against separatists in Chechnya and for decrying Russian intervention in the current conflict in Ukraine.

Osmayev denies involvement and no evidence has been presented linking him to the hit on Nemtsov, who was a relentless critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Within days of Nemtsov's assassination, investigators arrested five Chechens, including a senior officer in Kadyrov's police force, and charged them with carrying out the killing.

entry.title: Nemtsov suspects tells court he was pressured to confess
entry.summary: MOSCOW (AP) - A man charged with the killing of Russian opposition politician Boris Nemtsov on Wednesday told the court he was beaten and pressured to confess.

entry.title: Mother of 2 suspects in Nemtsov killing defends her sons
entry.summary: Anzor and Shagid Gubashev are among five men, all ethnic Chechens, accused in the shooting death of Nemtsov on a bridge near the Kremlin on Feb. 27.

entry.title: Russian MPs refuse to hold minute's silence for murdered Nemtsov
Nemtsov murder suspect likely 'confessed under torture,' activist says
entry.summary: Aides to Nemtsov, a former deputy prime minister, suspect Russia's state security apparatus is complicit in the crime.

entry.title: Suspect in Nemtsov killing likely confessed 'under torture'
entry.summary: A former Chechen police officer who admitted to taking part in the murder of Russian opposition figure Boris Nemtsov "likely confessed under torture", a member of the Kremlin's rights council says.

entry.title: Russian rights activist says evidence of torture on suspect charged with killing of Putin foe
entry.summary:
MOSCOW - The main suspect in Russian opposition politician Boris Nemtsov's killing has signs of torture on his body and was forced to confess to the shooting, a human rights activist said Wednesday.

Five people have been detained in connection with Nemtsov's shooting on Feb. 27.

entry.title: Nemtsov suspect tortured, forced to confess, activist says
Chechnya's leader vows loyalty to Putin amid Nemtsov probe
Two suspects held over murder of Kremlin critic Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Nemtsov was shot dead on the night of Feb. 27 within sight of the Kremlin walls, in the most high-profile killing of an opposition figure in the 15 years that President Vladimir Putin has been in power.

Separately, Russia's Interfax news agency, quoting a Chechen law enforcement source, said a man killed in a standoff with police in the Chechen capital Grozny late on Saturday had also been wanted by police in connection with Nemtsov's killing.

entry.title: Two suspects detained in murder of Boris Nemtsov, opposition leader who was gunned down in Moscow
entry.summary:
He said they were "suspected of carrying out this crime," but it was not clear if either of the suspects was believed to have fired the shots that killed Nemtsov as he and a companion walked over a bridge near the Kremlin on Feb. 27.

He blamed Western security services for Nemtsov's killing.

entry.title: Russia detains 2 suspects in killing of Boris Nemtsov
Two Detained In Killing Of Russian Opposition Politician
entry.summary:
Nemtsov's killing shocked Russia's already beleaguered and marginalized opposition supporters.

Suspicion in the opposition is high that the killing was ordered by the Kremlin in retaliation for Nemtsov's adamant criticism of President Vladimir Putin.

entry.title: Two held over killing of Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Russia's security chief says two suspects have been detained over the shooting death of Kremlin critic Boris Nemtsov.

Moscow: Two suspects have been detained in relation to the murder of Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov, the head of the Federal Security Service Alexander Bortnikov said.

entry.title: Russian opposition figure Boris Nemtsov wrote notes the day before he was shot dead
entry.summary: Now it has emerged that the day before his death, Mr Nemtsov and close aide Olga Shorina were discussing a sensitive investigation he was preparing into Moscow's backing for separatist fighters in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Witness to Boris Nemtsov slaying receiving death threats in Ukraine
entry.summary: The General Prosecutor's office in Kyiv said in a statement Friday that Anna Duritskaya, the 23-year old model who was walking with Nemtsov at the time of his killing, is being provided with protection.

entry.title: Sole witness in Nemtsov?s slaying receives death threats
entry.summary: Authorities in Ukraine say the sole witness in the killing in Moscow of prominent Russian opposition figure Boris Nemtsov has received death threats since returning to her family home in Ukraine.

entry.title: Russia's Putin calls Boris Nemtsov's murder political
entry.summary: The Kremlin has denied any involvement, saying that the killing was a "provocation" designed to discredit Putin and strengthen his opponents, but Nemtsov's friends say the Kremlin is to blame for fomenting an atmosphere of hatred towards its opponents.

entry.title: Putin says Nemtsov assassination a 'disgrace'
entry.summary: The vehicle drove past the spot where Mr Nemtsov was shot after the killing and when police patrol cars had already arrived at the scene, the statement said.

entry.title: Russia's Putin calls Boris Nemtsov's murder political
entry.summary: MOSCOW - Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday that the murder of Kremlin critic Boris Nemtsov was a shameful tragedy that carried a political subtext.

entry.title: Putin says opposition politician's murder is a 'disgrace'
entry.summary: The nation's top investigative agency also echoed Putin's comments, saying it was looking into whether Nemtsov had been a "sacrificial victim" to destabilize Russia.

entry.title: Putin says opposition politician Boris Nemtsov's murder is a 'disgrace' for Russia
entry.summary:
Putin condemned the slaying of Nemtsov, who was gunned down while walking on a bridge next to the Kremlin late Friday.

The Russian leader had sent his condolences to Nemtsov's mother, but his comments Wednesday were his first public remarks on the subject.

"We must finally rid Russia of the disgrace and tragedy of the kinds of things we recently saw and experienced: I mean the audacious murder of Boris Nemtsov in the very center of the capital."

Nemtsov, 55, one of Putin's most vehement critics, was killed just hours after a radio interview in which he denounced the president for his "mad, aggressive" policies in Ukraine.

entry.title: Russia's Putin calls Nemtsov's murder political
entry.summary: "I mean the murder, the audacious murder of Boris Nemtsov right in the centre of the capital," he said.

entry.title: Russian security service chief says several suspects in Nemtsov case: report
Growing fear in Russia leaves opposition in despair after murder of Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Signs reading "propaganda kills" and "Fight" lie among flowers and photos of slain opposition figure Boris Nemtsov at the site of his death.

Moscow: The murder of Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov was the last straw for Dmitry Ostashenko, who decided to give up his life as a logistics manager in Moscow and try to leave Russia with his wife.

"We can't live here any more," Mr Ostashenko, 31, an opposition activist like his wife, Inna Malashenko, said at the Sunday march to commemorate Mr Nemtsov, carrying a sign that said "I'm Not Afraid".

Zhanna, a daughter of murdered Russian opposition figure Boris Nemtsov, farewells her father in Moscow.

Candles glow as people gather for a memorial service before the funeral of slain opposition figure Boris Nemtsov in Moscow.

entry.title: Kremlin critic wants international probe into Nemtsov death
entry.summary:
Vladimir Putin's spokesman has called the killing of Nemtsov last week a "provocation," and Russian authorities are investigating.

He said he wants to help in any investigation, because Nemtsov helped raise attention to the case of whistleblower lawyer Sergei Magnitsky.

entry.title: EU condemns Russia over Nemtsov funeral bans
Memorial for slain Putin critic Boris Nemtsov draws thousands
entry.summary:
Relatives and friends pay their respects as they stand close to the coffin of Boris Nemtsov during a farewell ceremony in Moscow on March 3, 2015.

"The shots were fired not only at Nemtsov but at all of us, at democracy in Russia," Gennady Gudkov, a prominent Kremlin opponent, said in a speech delivered next to the coffin.

entry.title: Boris Nemtsov case: Russian mourners view body of slain opposition leader
entry.summary: Nemtsov's killing was the biggest political assassination in Russia since 2006, when another Kremlin foe, journalist Anna Politkovskaya, was shot to death in the elevator of her Moscow apartment building on Putin's birthday.

entry.title: Mourners view body of slain opposition leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Nemtsov had been a deputy prime minister under Russia's first elected president, Boris Yeltsin, who touted him as his likely successor before opting instead for Putin.

Putin dubbed Nemtsov's killing a "provocation," and nationwide TV networks quickly picked up the theme, blaming Western intelligence agencies, Ukrainian agents or even the opposition.

entry.title: Mourners view body of slain opposition leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
After paying their final tributes Tuesday to slain Kremlin critic Boris Nemtsov, many members of Russia's beleaguered opposition are looking into the future with gloom.

The sadness and loss that drew thousands to Nemtsov's funeral is unlikely to add vigor to the small and marginalized opposition, or dent the broad public support for President Vladimir Putin.

entry.title: Mourners view body of slain opposition leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Mourners are lining up outside a Moscow human rights center for the funeral of murdered Nemtsov.

Thousands of mourners and dignitaries filed past Nemtsov's white-lined coffin, and many wept as they offered flowers.

Divers searched for the gun in the Moscow River under the bridge where Nemtsov was killed by four shots in the back.

entry.title: Security cameras at Boris Nemtsov murder scene 'switched off'
entry.summary:
The Federal Guards Service, the agency responsible for Kremlin security, said none of its cameras had captured the crime because they faced inwards towards the Kremlin walls, not outwards to where Mr Nemtsov was shot.

Mr Nemtsov, 55, an opposition politician who had once been deputy prime minister, was murdered as he walked home from dinner with his 23-year-old Ukrainian girlfriend, Anna Duritskaya.

entry.title: Polish top senator: Russia banned me from Nemtsov's funeral
Polish top senator: Russia banned me from Nemtsov's funeral
entry.summary:
WARSAW, Poland (AP) - Poland's Senate speaker said Monday that Russia's authorities have denied him entry into the country for the funeral of slain Kremlin critic Boris Nemtsov.

Bogdan Borusewicz - Poland's leading opposition activist under communism - was to lead a delegation of Polish politicians and lawmakers attending Nemtsov's funeral Tuesday.

entry.title: Key Witness Didn't See Nemtsov's Killer
entry.summary: >>>>Mr. Nemtsov's funeral is scheduled for Tuesday.

entry.title: Video reports conflict in probe of Putin critic's slaying
entry.summary: They dined and then walked across a bridge near St. Basil's Cathedral, heading for Nemtsov's apartment across the Moscow River from the Kremlin, she said, her eyes welling with tears.

entry.title: Video reports conflict in probe of Putin critic's slaying
entry.summary:
Duritskaya said didn't see the man who shot Nemtsov, only a car speeding up.

TV Center, a station controlled by the Moscow city government, broadcast a poor-resolution video from a web camera that it said showed Nemtsov and Duritskaya shortly before he was killed.

entry.title: Boris Nemtsov's shaken girlfriend says she didn't see killer
entry.summary:
MOSCOW - Boris Nemtsov's girlfriend has broken her public silence on the murder of the Russian opposition activist, saying she did not see the killer who gunned him down as they strolled across a bridge near the Kremlin.

Speaking largely without emotion in deadened monosyllables, Ukrainian fashion model Anna Duritskaya said she had little recollection of what happened in the moments after Nemtsov was shot dead on Friday night.

It had not occurred to her that someone might be following them as they headed across the river towards Nemtsov's apartment.

entry.title: Russians march in memory of murdered Putin critic [Video]
entry.summary:
Putin has vowed to pursue those who killed Nemtsov, calling the murder a "provocation."

They say they are pursuing several lines of inquiry, including the possibility that Nemtsov, a Jew, was killed by radical Islamists or that the opposition killed him to blacken Putin's name.

Some young people walking in central Moscow asked: "Who is Nemtsov anyway?"

entry.title: Thousands march in Russia to mourn Putin critic Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
"It is a blow to Russia. If political views are punished this way, then this country simply has no future," Sergei Mitrokhin, an opposition leader, said of Nemtsov's murder.

He said Nemtsov's death was an irreparable loss and that he had "left his trace in Russia's history, in politics and public life".

Nemtsov was one of the leading lights of an opposition struggling to revive its fortunes three years after mass rallies against Putin failed to prevent him from returning to the presidency after four years as prime minister.

Putin has been Russia's dominant leader since 2000, when ailing President Boris Yeltsin chose the former KGB spy as his successor, a role Nemtsov had once been destined to play.

entry.title: Ukrainian model Anna Duritskaya was with Boris Nemtsov when he was murdered
entry.summary: Nemtsov was working on a report highlighting Russia's involvement in the separatist revolt in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Ukraine Prime Minister blames Vladimir Putin for Boris Nemtsov's death
entry.summary: Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov was shot dead in Moscow at the age of 55.

entry.title: Russian opposition mourns murdered leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Organizers of Sunday's march were divided after Nemtsov's death over whether to hold the rally or turn it into a demonstration of mourning in central Moscow.

Nemtsov briefly served as a deputy prime minister under President Boris Yeltsin in the late 1990s, when he gained a reputation as a leading liberal economic reformer.
